definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment

sentences.english: When the wind blows , the slender tree bends but never breaks.
sentences.chinese: 起风时，这棵细长的树常弯曲但决不会断。

sentences.english: Running our of grain, the army had to live on wild fruit and tree bark.
sentences.chinese: 部队断了粮，只能靠野果和树皮充饥。

sentences.english: We can not only become detached by realizing the true nature of things.
sentences.chinese: 只有断去这些关联，我们才能认清事物的本质。

sentences.english: He has also crushed my teeth with gravel; He has covered me with ashes.
sentences.chinese: 又用沙石碜断我的牙，用灰尘将我蒙盖。

sentences.english: What we say is we should even be ready to make some sacrifices for a way-out .
sentences.chinese: 我们说我们准备做出些牺牲是为了有个了断。

sentences.english: Put all the control switches on the position "off".
sentences.chinese: 将所有主令开关放在“断”的位置。

sentences.english: Meagan made the jump safely, but her father ended up with a broken leg.
sentences.chinese: 麦奇跳下桥后安全著陆，但她父亲的一条腿却断了。

sentences.english: Built-in high efficiency mini-breaker or low voltage plastic enclosure breaker.
sentences.chinese: 内装高分断小型断路器或低压塑壳式断路器。

sentences.english: Otherwise, we will have to send him a doctor and clean up all the problems.
sentences.chinese: 否则我们就只好给他送去一个医生来了断所有的问题。

sentences.english: The polygonal fault is tensional fault system with small throws, which is of nontectonic origin.
sentences.chinese: 多边形断层是一种非构造成因的断距微小的张性断层。

sentences.english: I bet our team wil win.
sentences.chinese: 我敢断我们的队能获胜。

sentences.english: The book records some of my brief thoughts in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 这本书只是记录了我这几年的一些断想。

sentences.english: After I did my business, I realized there was no toilet paper… and the water had been shut off months ago.
sentences.chinese: 等我拉完发现里面没有厕纸，并且这里的水早就断了。

sentences.english: He who can't forgive others destroys the bridge over which he himself must pass.
sentences.chinese: 不原谅别人的人也就等于断了自己的路。

sentences.english: One day a squawky Bird with a broken wing arrives in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 一天，一只断了翅膀的苍鹭来到了院子里。

definition: day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
(of systems, facilities etc) comprehensive/well-developed/excellent/to refine/to improve
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
(of time) to elapse or pass/(of a situation) to develop or evolve
